review_title: A not for profit that is growing and maturing
pros: YSAS has a strong name for itself in the youth sector. its staff are dedicated, hard working, and passionate about making a difference for young people. It is going through a period of growth and change, and is developing itself into an agency that is a great advocate for the young people it supports.  It has substantially changed its management practices to be more responsive to the needs of young people, and to be a better advocate for them.
cons: The company is going though substantial change at present. Despite this, it has a bright future ahead!

pros: Frontline workers have their hearts in the right place and are a pleasure to work with.
cons: Managers are out of touch with frontline workers. If your not a YES person you will get bullied or performance managed for advocating on behalf of staff and / or young people that you work for.

pros: Great clients and staff to work with
Get to work with young people
cons: Get dicked around by upper management re back pay
Poor organisational structure from the top

review_title: Great working with the client group (youth) but the work culture is quite toxic.
pros:
If you want to use your AOD skills to make a difference in the lives of young people, this place will give you that. 
The facilities are good and they have group supervision for workers. 
There are a couple of mid management people who are supportive of staff. 
The purpose of YSAS existence is very motivating.
cons:
The shifts are not managed well.  You may have a few night shifts then suddenly morning shift etc without any recovery time. 
Covert bullying is rife and many in management roles are either blind to it or they do not have the skills to address it.  Staff will not survive this workplace unless you know how to dodge around in the minefield of this kind of workplace culture.
The pay is not great, but no work in this sector pays well. You have to have a sense of 'higher purpose' or 'passion for the cause' to work in this area.

review_title: YSAS is losing sight of its purpose and core values
pros:
-Dedicated & Committed front line workers
-Laid back culture & Openness
cons:
-Poor leadership & lack of accountability
-Strong nepotism
-Obvious bullying & open disrespect by some leaders
-Complacent HR team
